review.title: Fault Diagnosis of Helical Gear Box using Large Margin K-Nearest Neighbors Classifier using Sound Signals
review.abstract: Gear drives are one of the most widely used transmission system in many machinery. Sound signals of a rotating machine contain the dynamic information about its health conditions. Not much information available in the literature reporting suitability of sound signals for fault diagnosis applications. Maximum numbers of literature are based on FFT (Fast Fourier Transform) analysis and have its own limitations with non-stationary signals like the ones from gears. In this paper, attempt has been made in using sound signals acquired from gears in good and simulated faulty conditions for the purpose of fault diagnosis through a machine learning approach. The descriptive statistical features were extracted from the acquired sound signals and the predominant features were selected using J48 decision tree technique. The selected features were then used for classification using Large Margin K-nearest neighbor approach. The paper also discusses the effect of various parameters on classification accuracy.

sections.text: Gear drives are one of the most widely used transmission systems in many machines.Sound signals from a rotating machine contain the dynamic information about their health conditions. In the literature, there is not much information about the suitability of sound signals for fault diagnostics applications. The maximum number of literature is based on FFT (Fast Fourier Transform) analyses and has its own limitations for non-stationary signals such as those from gearboxes. In this paper, an attempt was made to use sound signals obtained from gearboxes under good and simulated fault conditions for the purpose of fault diagnosis through a machine learning approach. Descriptive features were extracted from the recorded sound signals and the redominant features were selected using J48 decision tree technology, and the selected features were then used for classification using the Large Margin K-next neighbour approach.

sections.text: The sound signals were recorded for normal and abnormal conditions of the helicopter transmission. A total of 420 samples were collected, of which 60 were in healthy condition.
